Uses of Class
com.chaining.Chain

  • Packages that use Chain 
    Package Description
    com.chaining  
    com.chaining.interfaces  

    • Uses of Chain in com.chaining

      Methods in com.chaining that return Chain 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Chain<T> Chain.apply(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      apply an action to the stored item
      static <T> Chain<T> Chain.call(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> callable)
      start a chain of Functions throw passing a Callable that will return the root item
      Chain<T> Chain.debug(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      invoke the passed Consumer if the Application is in the debug mode, you can set the debugging mode in ChainConfiguration in the Application's onCreate()
      Chain<T> Optional.defaultIfEmpty(T defaultValue) 
      Chain<T> Chain.defaultIfEmpty(T defaultValue) 
      Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,java.lang.Boolean>> Chain.in(java.util.Collection<T> collection)
      check if the current Object in the chain is available in the passed Collection, the comparison will be through Object.equals(Object), if you need custom comparison, you can use in(Collection, BiPredicate) instead
      Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,java.lang.Boolean>> Chain.in(java.util.Collection<T> collection, io.reactivex.functions.BiPredicate<T,T> comparator)
      check if the current Object in the chain is available in the passed Collection
      Chain<T> Condition.invoke(io.reactivex.functions.Action action)
      invoke the passed action if the Predicate returned true, usually this is done for side-effects
      Chain<T> Chain.invoke(io.reactivex.functions.Action action)
      invoke an action before going to the next step in this chain, this operation is intended for side-effects
      static <T> Chain<T> Chain.let(T item)
      start a chain of Functions throw passing an item
      <R> Chain<R> Chain.map(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> mapper)
      a map function to convert the current Object in the Chain to another Object
      Chain<T> Guard.onErrorReturn(io.reactivex.functions.Function<java.lang.Throwable,T> function)
      provide a Function that will return a fallback item if the Callable that was passed to this Guard crashed
      Chain<T> Guard.onErrorReturnItem(T item)
      provide a fallback item if the Callable that was passed to this Guard crashed
      <R> Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,R>> Chain.pair(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> pairedItemMapper)
      pair the current item with another item which is the result of the passed function
      <R> Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,R>> Chain.pair(R item)
      pair the current item with another item
      Chain<T> Collector.reduce(io.reactivex.functions.BiFunction<T,T,T> reducer)
      reduce all the items in this Collector
      Chain<T> Condition.then(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      invoke the passed action if the Predicate returned true
      <R> Chain<R> Chain.to(java.util.concurrent.Callable<R> itemCallable)
      convert the current Chain to another Chain
      <R> Chain<R> Chain.to(R item)
      convert the current Chain to another Chain
      Chain<java.util.List<T>> Collector.toList()
      collect the added items into a List that holds no null values

    • Uses of Chain in com.chaining.interfaces

      Methods in com.chaining.interfaces that return Chain 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Chain<T> DefaultIfEmpty.defaultIfEmpty(T defaultValue)
      if the root item is converted to null due to any operation (like map() for example), this function will set it to a new default value
